												Very fun game that will have you hooked for hours developing your little (or not so little) gnome base and fending off the occasional Goblin invaders. Too bad the game tends to crash inexplicably and eventually borks your savefile, essentially ending your world. Then you start again... Unfortunately, I've had to start again one time too many. If you can deal with the occasional crash, do buy the game, you'll have loads of fun! If not, look for something else that is more stable.

								A Great Game!  There is plenty of content and lots to discover.  I have over 240+ hours and there is still more to do!  There is a very active community and if you need help just ask and you will most likely get it.  The game already has an incredible amount of content and its still in early access, and on top of that there is much more RoboBOb (the developer) Plans to add, like magic! (Don’t believe, me just scroll down to the LINKS section and click on the Roadmap link)Now be warned, this is a micro management village sandbox game, or you might call it, a city builder, so if you don't like that style of game then this is not the game for you!If you want to see what I’ve done you can find that in the LINKS section!Also, for those of you who are looking at the update page and are detoured from getting the game because it seems updates for this game have halted, it is because RoboBOb has opened up a Beta Branch.  A page on how to opt-in to that can be found it the LINKS section.Now to help ease one into the game without to many fallen kingdoms, I would recommend doing some research on the gameplay (in other words, READ SOME GUIDES).  Again, check the LINKS section for infoI mentioned a links section (like 20 times), so here it is!LINKS:   Site: http://gnomoria.com/    Forums: http://forums.gnomoria.com/index.php    Help: http://forums.gnomoria.com/index.php?board=4.0Roadmap: http://gnomoria.com/developer-plan/ My Kingdom: http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198087981854/screenshots/#scrollTop=0 How to Opt-In to Beta Branch http://forums.gnomoria.com/index.php?topic=6976.0    Guides: http://steamcommunity.com/app/224500/#scrollTop=0  http://forums.gnomoria.com/index.php?board=4.0 Gnomoria is simply a marvelous game, and I love it.  So what are you waiting for?  Go and get it!~Rchpweblo

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 9, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game has an steep curve for learning it because the user interface provides very few information about what the options do. For example, you won't know what is exactly produced in each of the workshops until you create one of each and see it. Before that, you need to guess given the 'name tag' of that workshop.Even if the initial steps are rough, the game is really fun. You can create anything you want for your gnomes, it is like playing Minecraft in a different setting and better balanced for single player. The game is also being updated fairly often (an update per month) given that developer team is very small, so things are expected to improve even more.

								This game helps scratch that "inner micro manager" itch. The workers (gnomes) are inherently hard workers, so don’t feel bad when you give them lots of work. Make sense?Great game, no end goal yet, but surviving is satisfying with the installed learning curve, on how to deal with hostiles.

Early Access Review
								I've always wanted to play dwarf fortress but always found it foreboding and never had the time to put up with the learning curve. Gnomoria provides just enough of the same feel with a more accessible UI and approach. There is nothing like building an entire town/kingdom from scratch designing and building every aspect and structure yourself. Then watching yourself get overrun by hordes of enemies because you neglected your defense.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 4, 2015
Early Access Review
								The game has a steep learning curve, but the community has plenty of good beginner guides to help you out there.  Once you get past the learning curve this game never really gets dull because eventually your gnomes will die, and you will have to start again.  The kingdom of your dreams will never come to fruition because when you think everything is going good one enemy that is possesed by the god of war himself will come and kill everything, and you will keep trying again and again until you realise you're never going to get that year of your life back, and then you'll keep going anyways.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 7, 2015
Early Access Review
								About three years ago I sank 400+ hours into this game and decided then it was the greatest $8 I ever spent in terms of value for money in a PC game. Now I play it sporadically but after tons of udates the game only gives you more. I'm not worried about when it will release (it's been in develpment a long, long time now) or if I ever even play it again. I got my money out of it and so will you. It is an awesome game with a lot of depth and freedom to play/build/destroy/design as you see fit. Best 'city/gnome' management game I've played in over 30 years of gaming. If you see this on sale for a couple bucks don't be an idiot. Buy it.
